The course was well organized to facilitate student learning
I received clear feedback that improved my learning

Comments_List: I learned a lot about networks, time management, and TCP sockets.
computer network protocols, system design principles and analysis
Different protocols and design of layers of networks.

I gained enormous knowledge of Java, multi-threaded and event-driven programming, and reading documentation. This is a phenomenal course for those who want to practice their programming applied to neat applications

Learned about layer architectures, network protocols, and system design evaluation. Also delved into analysis, queueing theory, and optimization. Explored general concepts about the internet architecture as well as detailed implementation decisions for specific protocols.
I think some of the assignments were a little too heavy - could have learned more topics in the area of networks and spent less time coding a TCP socket.
interesting projects, however, need better grading.
The assignments are quite interesting and helpful to understand the materials.
This is an incredible course. Lots of material packed into one semester but it was never overwhelming. Work always felt rewarding

In depth course on networking concepts, protocols, and system design. Probably too much content for a single course though. Hard to keep up with the implementation details and algorithmic design concepts as well. Specs for problem sets could be more detailed. Also grading was ambiguous and delayed.

stengths: the lectures were interesting and the instructor and TA were understanding

weaknesses: too much time was spent on a topic tangential to networking (high-performance server design), at the expense of more fundamental topics (the network and link layers).  homework 3 took a huge amount of time for very little conceptual understanding.
Yes, the material was interesting and you get a lot out of the assignments if you put in the time.
yes, networking is an essential part of computer science, and this course also reveals a big picture of general system design.
I would recommend this course because I learned a lot about networks and the materials are quite interesting. The programming assignments gave a chance to improve programming skills as well.
Midterms are fair and the programming assignments are tough but fair so start early. I had never coded in Java before and was able to learn no problem. Definitely take this class.

Every CS major who wants to work in industry (especially in infrastructure) should take this class. It is a TON of work and a lot of difficult content, but there is so much fundamental CS knowledge that is covered in this course, it's a huge loss to graduate without learning all of this. Take the class with a squad so you can go through slides together and understand the psets. It's a lot of work, but you'll also learn a ton.
only if they're interested in the topic
